page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION- HAMPTON
page.content: This Domesday Block situated at the extreme west of Herne Bay is over 95% sea with only a tiny portion of land in one corner. It is part of the area known as Hampton. The land rises quite steeply from the sea and is mainly used for housing with fine views over the Thames Estuary and towards the Isle of Sheppey. The lower land by the sea contains a grassed recreation area with a boating pool and some club houses. However although most of this area is now sea it should be noted that erosion, mainly caused during the last hundred years has meant that the remains of several old streets and houses now lie beneath the waters. At low tide blocks of the old sea wall rise out of the mud a hundred yards from the present wall. Some houses now 1/4 mile inland are built of material from houses threatened by the sea.
